basics.name: Arian Firoozi
basics.label: B.E. in Computer Engineering
basics.summary: A computer engineering student currently studying at University of Tehran

work.name: Industrial Automation and Intelligent Information Processing Lab., Univeristy of Tehran
work.summary:
I was a part of a systematic literature review of deep learning application in medical brain image registration, we analyzed 100+ papers. The paper is almost ready but results are not submitted yet. 
Under supervision of Professor Behzad Moshiri, Assistant Professor Mohammadreza Abolghasemi Dehaqani and Dr. Hamid Azadegan

work.name: High Performance Computing Lab., Univeristy of Tehran
work.summary:
Designed and implemented SNN networks, GUI and Python‑Verilog integration of an end‑to‑end GUI‑driven, hardware‑aware ANN to SNN. The resulting framework has Brian2 simulation and SystemVerilog export and supports LIF, Izhikevich and Hodgkin‑Huxley neurons. Results are ready but not submitted yet. 
Under supervision of Associate Professor Saeed Safari

work.name: UTCar Project (Autonomous Driving Platform), Univeristy of Tehran
work.summary:
Implemented deep reinforcement learning networks (e.g. DQN) for autonomous driving on HighwayEnv and Carla. Deployed and integrated HighwayEnv and Carla simulators with laboratory environment. Designed maps in SUMO simulator and converted results for Carla simulator. Gathered dataset and trained CNN networks for distance and trajectory estimation of a physical toy car. 
Under supervision of Associated Professor Mehdi Modarressi

work.name: Embedded Systems Lab., Univeristy of Tehran
work.summary:
Developed an application to convert PyTorch models to hardware compatible graphs with visual outputs. Designed a new GUI for existing project. 
Under supervision of Associated Professor Mostafa Ersali

Teaching Experience.summary: Lead organizer for the New York City branch of the People's Climate March, the largest climate march in history.
highlights: Awarded 'Climate Hero' award by Greenpeace for my efforts organizing the march.
Men of the year 2014 by Time magazine
